Judul: CHARACTERIZATION OF STORM EVENTS IN GO CONG DONG COASTAL REGION, SOUTH VIETNAM (IN CONJUNCTION TO EROSION DUE TO WIND-WAVE ACTIONS)
Abstrak: The erosion on Go Cong Dong coastal region is very severe. One of the causes is the attack of wind-generated wave. During the event of extreme speed, the winds produce much higher wave. This study intends to determine the behaviour of these extreme wind speeds on the region. 61 years of wind data (1955-2015) and statistical analysis (Extreme Value Analysis Ã‚Â– Gumbel Distribution) are used to predict the annual maxima throughout the year and its return value and period of these extreme wind speed. The result shows that the highest recorded speed is at 7.4 m/s and has a probability of occurring once every 31 years.
